intro: Myrmechila, commonly known as the golden mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant belonging to the family Viscaraceae. It typically grows on the branches of host trees, such as eucalyptus and acacia, drawing water and nutrients from them. The plant produces small, yellowish-green leaves and white, fleshy fruits that contain seeds covered in a sticky substance to aid in attachment to host plants. Myrmechila is native to Australia and is often found in woodland and heathland environments. Its ecological role includes providing food for various native birds and insects.
